chapters.title: The Last Call
chapters.summary: Washed-up safecracker Léo Moreau is drowning his failures in a Montmartre bar when he receives an unexpected and threatening visit.
key_events: Léo, haunted by a past job that left a man dead, drinks away his meager savings.
A slick, intimidating man named Durand delivers a sealed envelope.
The envelope contains incriminating photos of Léo's estranged daughter, implicating her in a crime she didn't commit.
A note demands he meet at midnight to discuss 'one last job' or the photos go to the police.
chapters.ending_hook: Léo stares at the photo of his daughter, realizing his retirement is over.

chapters.title: The Devil's Bargain
chapters.summary: Léo meets his blackmailer and learns the terrifying scale of the job he must perform.
key_events: The meeting is in a neon-lit, rain-slicked alley with Durand and his boss, the enigmatic 'La Veuve' (The Widow).
La Veuve, a figure of cold power, explains the target: the 'Scarlet Tears' necklace from the vault of crime lord Hugo Saint-Clair.
She provides blueprints of Saint-Clair's modernist fortified mansion on the Seine.
Léo's expertise with a rare, silent 1970s vault model is the key. Refusal means his daughter's ruin.
chapters.ending_hook: La Veuve smiles without warmth: 'The necklace is cursed, Monsieur Moreau. Let us hope the curse favors you.'

chapters.title: Casing the Ivory Tower
chapters.summary: Léo begins surveillance on Saint-Clair's impenetrable fortress, discovering unsettling details.
key_events: Léo observes the mansion's routines, guard shifts, and river-based security.
He reconnects with a cynical, aging forger named Simone to get necessary papers.
He learns of the necklace's legend: it brings ruin to any who possess it, but Saint-Clair seems immune.
Léo notices a high-ranking police official visiting Saint-Clair, a familiar and corrupt face from his past.
chapters.ending_hook: From his hiding spot, Léo sees Saint-Clair for the first time—a man of calm, terrifying authority—and feels a deep sense of dread.

chapters.title: Ghosts and Gear
chapters.summary: Léo assembles his tools and his fractured, reluctant crew for the impossible heist.
key_events: Léo recruits two old associates: Alain, a jumpy driver with debts, and Felix, a bitter ex-electrician.
Tension is high; the crew knows Saint-Clair's reputation for brutality.
Léo procures specialized thermal lances and sound-dampening equipment, depleting La Veuve's advance.
He visits his daughter in secret, lying about leaving the country, deepening his guilt.
chapters.ending_hook: As he tests the thermal lance, its blue flame casts hellish shadows. Felix mutters, 'We're not just cracking a safe. We're opening a coffin.'

chapters.title: Neon and Nerve
chapters.summary: The night of the heist arrives. The crew infiltrates the mansion during a lavish, decadent party.
key_events: Disguised as waitstaff, they enter the buzzing, drug-fueled party.
Léo and Felix break away to the sub-basement, bypassing initial electronic locks.
They encounter the vault door—a beautiful, brutalist masterpiece.
As Léo begins the delicate work, they hear a scream and a gunshot from the party above.
chapters.ending_hook: The vault door clicks open, revealing not just glittering jewels, but a plain, ledger-sized metal box sitting prominently in the center of the room.

chapters.title: The Scarlet Truth
chapters.summary: The heist turns into a massacre. Léo grabs the wrong prize.
key_events: Saint-Clair's head of security, a hulking man named Rocher, storms the vault with armed men.
A bloody firefight erupts; Felix is killed. Alain, waiting outside, panics.
In the chaos, Léo shoves the 'Scarlet Tears' into his bag but instinctively also grabs the heavy metal ledger box.
He escapes through a sewage outflow into the Seine, Rocher's bullets hitting the water around him.
chapters.ending_hook: Alone on a grimy riverbank, Léo opens the ledger. It's not jewels, but names, dates, and payments—a map of national corruption. He understands: this was the real target.

chapters.title: A Widow's Confession
chapters.summary: Léo confronts La Veuve, who reveals her true motive: revenge against the system that killed her magistrate husband.
key_events: Léo, now a hunted man, forces a meeting with La Veuve.
She admits she never wanted the necklace. The ledger, compiled by her husband, names everyone from police prefects to ministers on Saint-Clair's payroll.
She intended to leak it anonymously, using Léo as a deniable thief.
Now, with Saint-Clair and the corrupt state both alerted, Léo is the primary target holding the evidence.
chapters.ending_hook: As they argue, Durand bursts in: 'Saint-Clair has put a price on your head. And the DST (French intelligence) just raided your flat. They're not asking questions.'

chapters.title: Rats in the Labyrinth
chapters.summary: Léo goes underground, pursued by both mob enforcers and sinister government agents.
key_events: Léo uses old safecracker hideouts in the Catacombs and abandoned Metro stations.
He's chased by Rocher's brutal foot soldiers through a neon-lit wholesale market.
A separate, sleek team of government agents uses surveillance and threats, pressuring his few remaining contacts.
Léo realizes the only way out is to use the ledger, but publishing it makes him a target for the entire French establishment.
chapters.ending_hook: Cornered in a phone booth, he makes a desperate call to the only journalist he ever trusted, only to hear a strange click on the line—the call is already traced.

chapters.title: The Daughter in the Crosshairs
chapters.summary: Saint-Clair kidnaps Léo's daughter to force an exchange: the ledger for her life.
key_events: Léo learns his daughter, Claire, has been taken from her university dorm.
He receives a call: bring the ledger to the top of the half-constructed Tour Montparnasse at dawn.
La Veuve offers help, but Léo distrusts her. He must act alone.
He devises a desperate, risky plan involving the forger Simone and a fake ledger.
chapters.ending_hook: Ascending the skeletal skyscraper in the pre-dawn gloom, ledger in hand, Léo sees Claire held by Rocher, and Saint-Clair waiting calmly beside a government agent he recognizes from the ledger.

chapters.title: Betrayal at 210 Meters
chapters.summary: The exchange on the skyscraper turns into a three-way showdown.
key_events: Léo presents the fake ledger. The government agent, Inspector Roux, immediately identifies it as a forgery.
Roux reveals he wants the real ledger destroyed to protect the state, not to prosecute Saint-Clair.
A tense standoff erupts between Roux's men, Saint-Clair's thugs, and Léo.
La Veuve's sniper (Durand) intervenes from a nearby roof, causing chaos. Rocher is killed.
chapters.ending_hook: In the confusion, Léo and Claire escape down the construction elevator, but Saint-Clair escapes with the fake ledger, and Roux swears to hunt Léo to the ends of the earth for the real one.

chapters.title: Setting the Guillotine
chapters.summary: With no options left, Léo decides to weaponize the ledger publicly, ensuring his death will not bury the truth.
key_events: Léo and Claire hide in Simone's attic workshop. He explains the ledger's contents to his horrified daughter.
He contacts the journalist again, arranging a dead-man's switch: copies will be mailed to multiple press outlets if he doesn't call by a certain time.
He sends Claire into hiding with Simone, cutting all ties to protect her.
Léo chooses the ultimate stage for his last act: the iconic, decaying Palais Garnier opera house.
chapters.ending_hook: Alone in the shadowy opera house, ledger on his lap, Léo calls Roux and Saint-Clair, telling them where to find him and the evidence: 'Come and get it. The curtain goes up at midnight.'

chapters.title: Finale in Velvet and Blood
chapters.summary: The final confrontation in the opera house, where truth is the only weapon left.
key_events: Roux arrives with a team of 'cleaners.' Saint-Clair arrives with his last loyal enforcers. La Veuve watches from a dark balcony.
A three-way shootout echoes through the gilded halls. Léo uses his knowledge of the building's secret passages to stay ahead.
He rigs the opera house's PA system, broadcasting a reading of the ledger's key names to a police frequency Roux cannot block.
Léo confronts Saint-Clair on the stage, under the grand chandelier. Roux corners them both.
chapters.ending_hook: As police sirens converge (alerted by the broadcast), Léo tosses the real ledger into the orchestra pit. Roux shoots Saint-Clair. In the chaos, Léo slips into the shadows, a ghost in his own city. The ledger is recovered by honest cops, the scandal explodes, and Léo Moreau vanishes, his fate unknown, the velvet guillotine having finally fallen on the corrupt.
